biography_description: To some, they are cowards; to themselves, survivors.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Easier to rout in combat.</helpcolor>
name: Coward

effect_descriptions.name: Morale loss is increased by 25%, and morale gain is reduced by 25%.

biography_description: They are bound by pride, and know little of fighting as one.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Chance to deal reduced or no damage when adjacent to a friendly unit.</helpcolor>
name: Uncooperative

effect_descriptions.name: 10% <hyperlink>Fumble</hyperlink> chance when adjacent to another friendly unit.

biography_description: They soar through the skies on the noble griffons.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Griffon mount.</helpcolor>
name: Griffon Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Griffon Mount.

biography_description: They are vulnerable to damage from physical attacks.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Take more physical damage.</helpcolor>
name: Vulnerable to Physical

biography_description: They have a natural weakness to magic.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Take more magical damage.</helpcolor>
name: Vulnerable to Magic

biography_description: Legends say their bloodline was cursed with a weak constitution.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Units recover their health slowly.</helpcolor>
name: Weak Constitution

effect_descriptions.name: Health Regeneration in the <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink> is reduced by 50%

biography_description: They lose themselves in the heat of battle, blind to their own peril.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Defense mode is less effective.</helpcolor>
name: Careless

biography_description: Their bodies can barely contain their divine origin, sacred light radiates from within them like a purifying flame.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Melee attackers sustain <damageSpirit></damageSpirit> <hyperlink>Spirit Damage</hyperlink>.</helpcolor>
name: Inner Radiance

biography_description: Their happy demeanor makes them fearsome combatants.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Units more likely to critically hit.</helpcolor>
name: Cheerful

biography_description: Lightning runs through their veins, zapping those who dare to harm them.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Melee attackers sustain <damageLightning></damageLightning> <hyperlink>Lightning Damage</hyperlink>.</helpcolor>
name: Inner Lightning

biography_description: Their skin is cold to the touch, causing frostbite to those who get too close.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Melee attackers sustain <damageFrost></damageFrost> <hyperlink>Frost Damage</hyperlink>.</helpcolor>
name: Inner Frost

biography_description: Their boiling blood scorches anyone who dares to wound them.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Melee attackers sustain <damageFire></damageFire> <hyperlink>Fire Damage</hyperlink>.</helpcolor>
name: Inner Fire

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Raptor mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have tamed the elusive Swiftfoot Raptors.
name: Swiftfoot Raptor Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Raptor mount.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units become stronger when they sustain magical damage.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They find power through magical pain.
name: Empowered by Magic

effect_descriptions.name: Once per turn, when taking non-<damagePhysical></damagePhysical> <hyperlink>Physical Damage</hyperlink> damage, gain Strengthened for 3 <turn></turn> Turns.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Adjacent enemies have a chance to miss their attacks.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They communicate through a cacophony of noise that would drive anyone else mad.
name: Ceaseless Cacophony

effect_descriptions.name: Adjacent enemies without this trait have a 15% <hyperlink>Fumble</hyperlink> chance.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain an Eagle mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They soar through the skies on giant eagles.
name: Eagle Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with an Eagle mount.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common</helpcolor>
biography_description: They ride to battle on impressive cavalry.
name: Mount Masters

biography_description: They share a deep kinship with mighty Elephants.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain an Elephant mount </helpcolor>
name: Elephant Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with an Elephant Mount.

biography_description: They have tamed the furry Mammoths from the tundra.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Mammoth mount.</helpcolor>
name: Mammoth Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Mammoth mount.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units can consume plants in order to heal and strengthen themselves.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They consume plants to revitalize themselves.
name: Herbivore

biography_description: They surround and overrun their enemies.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Deal more damage to enemies surrounded by your units.</helpcolor>
name: Pack Tactics

effect_descriptions.name: Gain the Pack Hunter passive ability.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Moving around and settling in Ashland areas becomes easier.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They thrive on barren lands.
name: Desolate Adaptation

effect_descriptions.name: Gain Desolate Walk, increasing world map movement speed on Ashlands.
Able to build <farm></farm> <hyperlink>Farms</hyperlink> on Ashland terrain.
Cities ignore the <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> penalty from Lava and Chasm terrain in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They made friends with the Dire Bears.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Dire Bear mount </helpcolor>
name: Dire Bear Mount

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Dire Bear mount

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units can see further on the World Map</helpcolor>
biography_description: They can see farther than others.
name: Sharp Eyes

lore_description: <helpcolor>Allows for better positioning by being able to move through friendly units.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They move past their own troops with ease.
name: Light Footed

effect_descriptions.name: Friendly units do not block movement.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Reduces the resistance to magic and status effects of nearby units.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have a grisly stench following them.
name: Hideous Stench

effect_descriptions.name: Adjacent enemies without this trait suffer:<bulletlist><bullet>-2 <resistance></resistance> <hyperlink>Resistance</hyperlink></bullet><bullet>-2 <statuseffectresistance></statuseffectresistance> <hyperlink>Status Resistance</hyperlink></bullet>

lore_description: They study the stars, channeling their blessings when they act under their guidance.
biography_description: Always gazing at the stars, they act under their guidance.
name: Astrological Diviners

effect_descriptions.name: Every 10th <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>:<bulletlist><bullet>Your <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> gain Aligned Stars.</bullet><bullet>Non-Hero Units drafted, raised, or summoned during a 10th Turn permanently gain Born Under the Stars.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>City Structures</hyperlink> and <hyperlink>Special Province Improvements</hyperlink> completed during a 10th Turn grant 100 <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

starting_bonuses.description: Starting <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> gain +1 rank.

biography_description: Where the land is infested, they strike with lawful strength.
lore_description: They keep the lands safe and restore balance between warring neighbors.
name: Vigilante Knights

effect_descriptions.name: Completing <hyperlink>Bounties</hyperlink> grants +50% <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and an additional 100 <influence></influence> <hyperlink>Imperium</hyperlink> as rewards.

Whenever you have no <hyperlink>Bounties</hyperlink> active, gain a bounty offer targeting a nearby existing <hyperlink>Infestation</hyperlink> that hasn't been targeted before. It will not generate a new bounty if no more Infestations can be found.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with +1 <unitHero></unitHero> <hyperlink>Hero Cap</hyperlink> and +3 Hero Cap for Pantheon heroes.

biography_description: They elevate their heroes above the masses, empowered through dark elation.
lore_description: They believe in the might of their heroes, the chosen few, elevated above the masses.
name: Cult of Personality

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Heroes</hyperlink> gain a bonus Skill Point whenever they gain a <renown></renown> <hyperlink>Renown</hyperlink> Level.
<hyperlink>Heroes</hyperlink> gain +10 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> <hyperlink>Unit Upkeep</hyperlink> whenever they gain a <renown></renown> <hyperlink>Renown</hyperlink> Level.
In combat, <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> in an <hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> without a Hero suffer -20 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>Morale</hyperlink>.

biography_description: It is said that the Umbral Thralls were once a free civilization governed by a benevolent hivemind. Yet through <hyperlink>Urrath's eldritch lashes</hyperlink>, the minds of the Umbral Thralls became enchained, and their hive was twisted into an instrument of enslavement. As will-less drones they serve as unceasing warriors, laborers, or as a harvest of souls to satiate the hunger of the <hyperlink>Umbral Demons</hyperlink>. Their swarm carries the gloom to other realms, so that other free peoples across the <hyperlink>Astral Sea</hyperlink> might share the same terrible fate.
lore_description: It is said that the Umbral Thralls were once a free civilization governed by a benevolent hivemind. Yet through <hyperlink>Urrath's eldritch lashes</hyperlink>, the minds of the Umbral Thralls became enchained, and their hive was twisted into an instrument of enslavement. As will-less drones they serve as unceasing warriors, laborers, or as a harvest of souls to satiate the hunger of the <hyperlink>Umbral Demons</hyperlink>. Their swarm carries the gloom to other realms, so that other free peoples across the <hyperlink>Astral Sea</hyperlink> might share the same terrible fate.
name: Umbral Thralls
screen_description: These are the Initiates of the Umbral Abyss, who use otherworldly magic that mutates them with extra limbs. Their pact with the abyss makes their flesh twisted and immune to the Umbral Malady.

effect_descriptions.name: This race are designated thralls for all <hyperlink>Umbral Dwellings</hyperlink> in the realm and will primarily appear in the <hyperlink>Umbral Abyss</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They soar through the skies on Celestial griffons.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Celestial Griffon mount.</helpcolor>
name: Celestial Griffon Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Celestial Griffon Mount.

biography_description: Their beasts and troops have been trained in the art of chariot warfare.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Chariot mount.</helpcolor>
name: Chariot Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Reduces members in the unit to one, granting immunity to <hyperlink>Casualties</hyperlink>.
Ruler starts with a Chariot mount.

biography_description: They soar through the sky on majestic Pegasi.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Pegasus mount.</helpcolor>
name: Pegasus Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Pegasus mount

biography_description: They have tamed the tunneling Death Beetles.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Death Beetle mount.</helpcolor>
name: Death Beetle Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Death Beetle mount.

lore_description: Fated to bring about great change to the Realm.
biography_description: Destined to bring about a ruinous change to the Realm.
name: Vision of Ruin

effect_descriptions.name: On arrival in the Realm, you must interpret a vision of Ruin:<bulletlist><bullet><chaos></chaos> <hyperlink>Chaos Affinity</hyperlink>: War shall engulf the Realm.</bullet><bullet><arcana></arcana> <hyperlink>Astral Affinity</hyperlink>: The Arcane shall dominate.</bullet><bullet><shadow></shadow> <hyperlink>Shadow Affinity</hyperlink>: Death will reign.</bullet></bulletlist>
Trigger a powerful global effect upon completion.

lore_description: Bearing the mark of an affinity, they are destined for greatness.
biography_description: Marked by an affinity, they are set upon a path they do not yet see.
name: Vision of Destiny

effect_descriptions.name: On arrival in the Realm, you must interpret a vision of what your people are destined to become:<bulletlist><bullet><order></order> <hyperlink>Order Affinity</hyperlink>: Peacemakers.</bullet><bullet><chaos></chaos> <hyperlink>Chaos Affinity</hyperlink>: Conquerors.</bullet><bullet><arcana></arcana> <hyperlink>Astral Affinity</hyperlink>: Scholars.</bullet><bullet><matter></matter> <hyperlink>Materium Affinity</hyperlink>: Artisans.</bullet><bullet><nature></nature> <hyperlink>Nature Affinity</hyperlink>: Cultivators.</bullet><bullet><shadow></shadow> <hyperlink>Shadow Affinity</hyperlink>: Deathbringers.</bullet></bulletlist>
Permanently empower your units upon completion.

lore_description: Prophecy will bring them to a new home.
biography_description: They are destined to settle in a land of promise.
name: Vision of Promise

effect_descriptions.name: On arrival in the Realm, you must interpret a vision of Promise:<bulletlist><bullet><order></order> <hyperlink>Order Affinity</hyperlink>: The promise is a land that must be conquered.</bullet><bullet><matter></matter> <hyperlink>Materium Affinity</hyperlink>: The promise is a home that must be built.</bullet><bullet><nature></nature> <hyperlink>Nature Affinity</hyperlink>: The promised land is occupied by a monster we must defeat.</bullet></bulletlist>
Gain a powerful Throne City upon completion.

biography_description: Beneath the earth, they can be found, prospering and digging deeper still.
lore_description: They know the earth like no other, favoring the depths of the realms to the turbulent surface.
name: Subterranean Society

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Excavation</hyperlink> of Underground provinces has a chance of uncovering an additional <hyperlink>Resource Node</hyperlink>.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Scout Unit.

biography_description: Ever on the move, travel is at the heart of their culture.
lore_description: They are ever on the move, with travel at the heart of their culture.
name: Swift Marchers

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Forced March</hyperlink> inflicts no damage to your <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink>.

biography_description: Their vast knowledge earns them power and respect throughout the realms.
lore_description: They know knowledge is power, and power demands respect.
name: Keepers of Knowledge <goodact></goodact>

effect_descriptions.name: Unlocking a new Research Skill grants +10 <hyperlink><allegiance></allegiance>Allegiance</hyperlink> with all <minorcity></minorcity><hyperlink>Free Cities</hyperlink> to whom you have assigned a <whisperingStone></whisperingStone> <hyperlink>Whispering Stone</hyperlink>.
Unlocking a new <hyperlink>Tome</hyperlink> grants +100 Relation with all <hyperlink>Empires</hyperlink>.
Gain +10 <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink> income for each empire you have <hyperlink>Open Borders</hyperlink> with.

biography_description: They know the shadows are not to be feared, but to be studied and used.
lore_description: The shadows whisper, and the disciples listen.
name: Umbral Disciples <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: Start with Ritual of the Gloomveil unlocked.
Cities may build the <conduit></conduit> Altar of Marching Gloom.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with Umbral Flesh active.
Start with an extra Elemental unit.

biography_description: Caretakers of the natural order, maintaining a carefully tended biome.
lore_description: Caretakers of the natural order, maintaining a carefully tended biome.
name: Druidic Terraformers

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> gain <bulletlist><bullet>+20% <food></food> <hyperlink>Food</hyperlink> if the city core province contains Grasslands, Fungus Fields or Swamp.</bullet><bullet>+20% <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink> if the city core province contains Forest, Rocky or Mountains.</bullet><bullet>+10% <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> if the city core province contains Ashlands.</bullet><bullet>+10% <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> if the city core province contains Snow, Ice or Sand.</bullet></bulletlist>
Terraforming spells cost -25% less <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink> to cast.

biography_description: They are merciless, viewing life as another prize to be claimed.
lore_description: They are merciless; to them, life is a commodity that may be taken by blade or chain.
name: Merciless Slavers <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Routing</hyperlink> <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> are <hyperlink>Captured</hyperlink> if your side is victorious in <hyperlink>Combat</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They are absolute in their crusade to root out evil.
lore_description: They are absolute in their dedication to rooting out evil, sparing no mercy for the wicked.
name: Relentless Crusaders <goodact></goodact>

effect_descriptions.name:
Gain 2 Imperium for each Empire Unit killed after successful combat.

This reward increases by +1 for each level of evil Alignment of the Faction they belonged to.

starting_bonuses.description: 100<influence></influence>

biography_description: They believe peace and quiet is vital for study, and will fight to ensure that peace and quiet is achieved.
lore_description: They seek only to be left alone to their studies and will aggressively protect their studious isolation from any disturbances.
name: Hermit Kingdom

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> gain +15% <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink>, +15% <food></food> <hyperlink>Food</hyperlink>, +15% <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink>, and +20 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> income when their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink> does not border the <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink> of any other <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> or <hyperlink>Outpost</hyperlink>.
Grievances inflicted by other empires encroaching on your territory are increased by +100%.

starting_bonuses.description: 200<bindingessence></bindingessence>

biography_description: They believe everything must be reclaimed and reforged stronger.
lore_description: They believe anything can be reforged into something better, but before that can be done, it must be reclaimed.
name: Reclaimers

effect_descriptions.name: Gain <hyperlink><bindingessence></bindingessence> Binding Essence and <bindingfragments></bindingfragments> Fragments</hyperlink> for clearing <hyperlink>Infestation Spawners</hyperlink>, clearing <hyperlink>Ancient Wonders</hyperlink>, <hyperlink>Razing</hyperlink> <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink>, and <hyperlink>Pillaging</hyperlink> <hyperlink>Provinces</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They share a deep kinship with the honorable Gracious Judges.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Graceful Judge mount.</helpcolor>
name: Graceful Judge Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Gain the Touch of Grace ability.
Ruler starts with a Graceful Judge mount.

biography_description: They soar through the skies on grand blessed dragons.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Blessed Dragon mount.</helpcolor>
name: Blessed Dragon Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Blessed Dragon mount.

starting_bonuses.description: Get 2 random hero items.

biography_description: They pursue and covet magical equipment, using such items as inspiration for their magical feats.
lore_description: They pursue and covet magical equipment, using such items as inspiration for their magical feats.
name: Equipment Hoarders

effect_descriptions.name: Gain a tier II-III Hero Item after clearing an <hyperlink>Ancient Wonder</hyperlink> or an <hyperlink>Infestation</hyperlink>.
Gain extra <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> with Hero Items via the <hyperlink>Equipment Hoard</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They value and cultivate good relationships with their vassals.
lore_description: They value and cultivate good relationships with their vassals, raising their banners in times of war.
name: Bannerlords

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Rally of the Lieges</hyperlink> occur twice as often

starting_bonuses.description: Start with the nearest <minorcity></minorcity><hyperlink>Free City</hyperlink> revealed and gain +25 <hyperlink><allegiance></allegiance>Allegiance</hyperlink> with them.
Start with an extra Battle Mage Unit or Support Unit.

biography_description: A people who have embraced magic to a degree few can match, gaining more than most from spells, but becoming dependent on them in turn.
lore_description: They have embraced magic to a degree few can match, gaining more than most from its prowess... but becoming dependent on its marvel in return.
name: Mana Addicts

effect_descriptions.name: Provinces with Mana <hyperlink>Resource Nodes</hyperlink> grant +10 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink>.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra tier 3 <hyperlink>Unit</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They hold artisans in high regard. Every mason or thatcher is an artist in their own right, given the time and resources needed to work their art.
lore_description: They demand perfection of their artisans, taking their time to build marvels like no other.
name: Perfectionist Artisans

effect_descriptions.name: City Structures cost 100% more <structureprod></structureprod> Production but grant +1 <happiness></happiness> City Stability and +5 <gold></gold> Gold in addition to their normal effects.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with a <hyperlink>Magic Material</hyperlink> nearby.

biography_description: They are fascinated by rare materials and spend large parts of their lives collecting and studying them.
lore_description: They are fascinated by rare materials and spend large parts of their lives collecting and studying them.
name: Talented Collectors

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> gain +5 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink>, <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink>, <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink>, <food></food> <hyperlink>Food</hyperlink>, <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink>, and <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink> for each <hyperlink>Magic Material</hyperlink> in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They are warmongers and destroyers, choosing violence over diplomacy any time they can.
lore_description: They are warmongers and destroyers, choosing violence over diplomacy any time they can.
name: Chosen Destroyers <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: Razing cities grant a permanent +40 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink>, +40 <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink>, and +40 <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink> income for every 3 <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink> of the city that was razed.
Can not obtain new <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> and conquered cities can only be razed.

Suffer -300 <hyperlink>Relations</hyperlink> with all <minorcity></minorcity><hyperlink>Free Cities</hyperlink> and -300 <hyperlink>Empire Relations</hyperlink> with all other <hyperlink>Empires</hyperlink>

biography_description: They know when to flatter and when to extort, elevating intrigue itself to a lucrative art.
lore_description: They know when to flatter and when to extort, elevating intrigue itself to a lucrative art.
name: Silver Tongued

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Trade</hyperlink> with <minorcity></minorcity><hyperlink>Free Cities</hyperlink> costs you -100% resources. (Cost increases from other sources still apply!)

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Scout Unit.

biography_description: They believe it is their calling to unite all societies.
lore_description: They strive to build a realm based on cooperation, but will not hesitate to defend it.
name: Chosen Uniters <goodact></goodact>

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> recruited through <hyperlink>Rally of the Lieges</hyperlink> gain +1 Rank upon recruitment.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Shield Unit or Polearm Unit.

lore_description: This race is dedicated to unraveling the secrets of the past. They make for keen scholars of ancient sites, but become restless when bound to their ordinary lives.
biography_description: Their society is dedicated to unraveling the secrets of the past. This makes them keen scholars of ancient sites, but also restless when bound to their ordinary lives.
name: Mark of the Owl
screen_description: Their society is dedicated to unraveling the secrets of the past. This makes them keen scholars of ancient sites, but also restless when bound to their ordinary lives.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race gain <xpCol>+15</xpCol> <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink> from cleared <hyperlink>Ancient Wonders</hyperlink> in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race have <fireCol>-20</fireCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> when there is no cleared <hyperlink>Ancient Wonder</hyperlink> in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

lore_description: Driven by the desire to possess material wealth, this race values gold above anything else.
biography_description: Driven by the desire to possess material wealth, they value gold above anything else.
name: Mark of the Hoard
screen_description: Driven by the desire to possess material wealth, they value gold above anything else.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race gain <xpCol>+1</xpCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> for each 70 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> in their controller's global <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> reserve up to a maximum of +30 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink>.
<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race generate <fireCol>-1</fireCol> <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> for each <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink> they have.

lore_description: The people thrive in peacefulness and pacifism.
biography_description: Their society thrives in peacefulness and pacifism.
name: Mark of the Dove
screen_description: Their society thrives in peacefulness and pacifism.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race gain <xpCol>+2</xpCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> for each <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink>.
<hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> of this race earn <fireCol>-50%</fireCol> <hyperlink><xp></xp> Experience</hyperlink> in combat.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Moving around and settling in swamp areas becomes easier.</helpcolor>
biography_description: Living around or on water is second nature to them.
name: Swamp Adaptation

effect_descriptions.name: Gain Swamp Walk and River Walk, increasing world map movement speed in swamps and rivers.
Ignore the -2 <food></food> <hyperlink>Food</hyperlink> penalty from building <farm></farm> <hyperlink>Farms</hyperlink> in Swamps.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Moving around and settling in desert areas becomes easier.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They are used to the scorching desert sun.
name: Desert Adaptation

effect_descriptions.name: Gain Sand Walk, increasing world map movement speed on sand.
Able to build <farm></farm> <hyperlink>Farms</hyperlink> on Sand terrain.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Moving around and settling in cold areas becomes easier.</helpcolor>
biography_description: The harsh cold no longer bothers them.
name: Arctic Adaptation

effect_descriptions.name: Gain Arctic Walk, increasing world map movement speed on snow and ice.
Able to build <farm></farm> <hyperlink>Farms</hyperlink> on Snow terrain.

biography_description: They can thrive underground as well as anyone else could above ground.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Moving around and settling underground becomes easier.</helpcolor>
name: Underground Adaptation

effect_descriptions.name: Gain Cave Walk, increasing world map movement speed in most underground terrain.
Can build<farm></farm> <hyperlink>Farms</hyperlink> instead of <hut></hut> <hyperlink>Huts</hyperlink> in Fungus Fields, Underground Ashlands, and Underground Snow.
Cities ignore the <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> penalty from Lava and Chasm terrain in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units at low health will still deal a lot of damage.</helpcolor>
biography_description: The more they are pushed to the edge, the harder they will fight.
name: Tenacious

effect_descriptions.name: Damage penalties from Casualties are halved.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Great for mobile hit and run tactics.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have trained to dart in and out of combat, not giving their enemies much time to strike back.
name: Elusive

effect_descriptions.name: Gains +5 Defense and Resistance against Retaliation Attacks and Opportunity Attacks.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units normally only have 32 movement.</helpcolor>
biography_description: Trained in long distance running, they are exceptionally fast.
name: Athletics

effect_descriptions.name: Fast Movement, having 40 movement on the <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink> and in <hyperlink>Combat</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They have trained to cover any gaps in their defensive formations.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Units become tougher when standing next to allies.</helpcolor>
name: Defensive Tactics

effect_descriptions.name: +1 Defense, +1 Resistance and +10% Evasion when standing next to a friendly unit with Defensive Tactics. This does not stack.

biography_description: They work together to bring down even the largest of foes.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Units deal more damage when fighting in groups.</helpcolor>
name: Overwhelm Tactics

effect_descriptions.name: +20% <crit></crit>Critical Hit Chance when standing next to a friendly unit with Overwhelm Tactics. This does not stack.

biography_description: To them, the best defense are their shields and their patience in battle.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Encourages a slow and steady play style.</helpcolor>
name: Bulwark

lore_description: <helpcolor>Useful for armies focusing on battle mages.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They prefer to fight using magic.
name: Arcane Focus

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units are less likely to be affected by <hyperlink>Negative Status Effects</hyperlink> and shrug them off faster.</helpcolor>
biography_description: Their natural resilience makes them less likely to be affected by magic.
name: Resilient

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Negative Status Effects</hyperlink> last -1 <turn></turn> Turn, with a minimum of 1.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Your units can take a little more damage.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They are vigorous and strong, true beacons of health.
name: Hardy

starting_bonuses.description: Wayfinder Enchantment is already active and costs no upkeep.
Start with an extra Scout Unit.

biography_description: They are talented spies, sneaking past enemy lines to gain precious information.
lore_description: They are talented spies, sneaking past enemy lines to gain precious information.
name: Devious Watchers

effect_descriptions.name: Cities and Provinces have +2 Vision Range.
<hyperlink>Outposts</hyperlink> start with the Watch Tower upgrade built.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Battle Mage Unit or Support Unit.

biography_description: They have a talent for destructive magic, and it shows.
lore_description: They emanate raw power as they release an endless barrage of destruction upon all in their path.
name: Powerful Evokers

effect_descriptions.name: Battle Mage Units and Support Units provide +5 <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink> Combat Casting Points</hyperlink> at the start of combat.

biography_description: They dismiss silly ideas of morals and compassion, knowing that knowledge and power are the true virtues worth striving for.
lore_description: They share a thirst for knowledge and power, thriving in their pursuit of Evil.
name: Scions of Evil <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: Cities gain +10 <unitprod></unitprod> Draft and your empire gains +5 <influence></influence> Imperium per level of Evil Alignment.

Units cost -20% less <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink> to recruit while you are at the maximum evil <evilact></evilact> <hyperlink>Alignment</hyperlink>.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Shock Unit or Shield Unit.
1 nearby ancient wonders cleared.

biography_description: They are inspired by unique constructions and the Ancient Wonders of old.
lore_description: They are inspired by unique constructions and the Ancient Wonders of old.
name: Wonder Architects

effect_descriptions.name: Ancient Wonders do not require <population></population> Population in order to be annexed to a City.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Shield Unit or Polearm Unit.

biography_description: They are legendary smiths, capable of crafting the finest armor and weapons.
lore_description: They are legendary smiths, weaving magic into their finely crafted creations through enchantments.
name: Runesmiths

effect_descriptions.name: <caststrategic></caststrategic> Unit Enchantment Research cost -40% <knowledge></knowledge> Knowledge to unlock.

biography_description: They honor their builders and artisans, taking pride in their grand constructions.
lore_description: They form a society of builders and makers who take pride in the things they construct.
name: Great Builders

biography_description: They are experienced seafarers, sharing many stories of adventurous sailors and sea monsters.
lore_description: With strong sea legs, they are unrivaled on the water and know how to dredge up extra value from its depths.
name: Experienced Seafarers

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> gain +2 <gold></gold> Gold, +2 <food></food> Food, and +2 <unitprod></unitprod> Draft for each province with a Coast, River, and Water in their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

biography_description: They are pioneers and settlers, founding cities wherever they go.
lore_description: They are pioneers and settlers, founding cities wherever they go.
name: Adept Settlers

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Ranged Unit.

biography_description: They are legendary hunters, excelling in ranged combat and exploration.
lore_description: They are legendary hunters, excelling in ranged combat and exploration.
name: Fabled Hunters

effect_descriptions.name: Gain +75% resources from clearing an <hyperlink>Infestation</hyperlink>, <hyperlink>Ancient Wonder</hyperlink>, or <hyperlink>Resource Node</hyperlink>.
Units regenerate an additional +5 <hyperlink><hp></hp> Hit Points</hyperlink> per <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Magic Origin unit.

biography_description: Their society is attuned to the Astral Flows, enabling them to channel arcane powers.
lore_description: They are attuned to the Astral Flows and support their armies by channeling arcane powers.
name: Mana Channelers

effect_descriptions.name: Summoning Spells cost -50% <mana></mana> Mana to cast.

biography_description: They are blessed with an innate talent for spellcasting.
lore_description: They are blessed with an innate talent for spellcasting, rarely encountering problems that can't be solved by an abundant use of magic.
name: Gifted Casters

starting_bonuses.description: Start with 1 extra Spell unlocked.

lore_description: They believe both in the spiritual power of life... and in the value of a good banquet.
biography_description: They sacrifice their people to gain favor from their gods.
name: Ritual Cannibals <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: Units gain the Corpse Eating ability.
The nearest City owned gains +3 <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and +3 <food></food> <hyperlink>Food</hyperlink> per tier of non-Magic Origin units killed or lost after successful combat.

starting_bonuses.description: Get 2 random hero items.

biography_description: They murder without remorse. For them, loot and plunder are more important than right or wrong.
lore_description: They murder without remorse, more interested in loot and plunder than right or wrong.
name: Ruthless Raiders <evilact></evilact>

effect_descriptions.name: The nearest City owned gains +3 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and +3 <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink> per tier of units killed after successful combat.

starting_bonuses.description: Capital city starts with +1 <population></population> Population.

biography_description: They are known imperialists, proud of their people and their developed culture.
lore_description: They are focused on the glory of their empire and the development of their cities.
name: Imperialists

effect_descriptions.name: The <hyperlink>Throne City</hyperlink> and cities that share a border with the Throne City gain +20 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> and +20 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> income.

biography_description: They share pure intentions, compassion and an unerring devotion to the good cause.
lore_description: They share pure intentions, compassion and an unerring devotion to the cause of Good.
name: Devotees of Good <goodact></goodact>

effect_descriptions.name: Cities gain +10 <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and your empire gains +5 <influence></influence> Imperium per level of Good Alignment.
Units gain +2 <hyperlink><xp></xp> Experience</hyperlink> per <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink> while you are at the maximum good <goodact></goodact> <hyperlink>Alignment</hyperlink>.

starting_bonuses.description: Start with an extra Support Unit or Polearm Unit.
Start with an extra Tier I unit.

biography_description: They find their strength in fast population growth and overwhelming numbers.
lore_description: They find their strength in fast population growth and overwhelming numbers.
name: Prolific Swarmers

effect_descriptions.name: Racial Tier I units have +1 Rank.
Non-Magic Origin units require -20% base <hyperlink>Unit Upkeep</hyperlink>.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Wolf mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have made companions of the White Wolves.
name: White Wolf Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Gains the Pack Hunter passive ability.
Ruler starts with a White Wolf mount

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Nightmare mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have tamed the Flaming Horses of the Inferno.
name: Nightmare Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Nightmare mount

lore_description: <helpcolor>Great for fighting enemies up close.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They hone their reflexes and will not let their enemy walk away from a fight unscathed.
name: Ferocious

effect_descriptions.name: Deals +40% damage via Retaliation Attacks and <hyperlink>Opportunity Attacks</hyperlink>.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Increases the damage of melee and ranged units.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They pride themselves on their strength and musculature.
name: Strong

effect_descriptions.name: Single Shot <hyperlink>Melee</hyperlink> and <hyperlink>Physical Ranged</hyperlink> attacks deal +4 <damagePhysical></damagePhysical> <hyperlink>Physical Damage</hyperlink>.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Reduce damage from magical attacks and spells.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They have a natural armor against magical damage.
name: Resistant

effect_descriptions.name: +1 <defense></defense> <hyperlink>Defense</hyperlink> and +1 <resistance></resistance> <hyperlink>Resistance</hyperlink> against <hyperlink>Magic</hyperlink> attacks, <hyperlink>Spells</hyperlink> and other effects.

biography_description: They harbor knowledge dating back to the beginning of time.
lore_description: They have been around since the start of history, honing their minds in the pursuit of arcane knowledge.
name: Ancient Wise Ones

effect_descriptions.name: When a Tome is unlocked, a random skill from that Tome costs -60% <knowledge></knowledge> Knowledge.

starting_bonuses.description: 1 random research skill is already unlocked.

biography_description: They are known to eat the bodies of their own kind as well as other tasty humanoids.
name: Cannibals

biography_description: At one point these creatures grew to be hideously mutated, making them a horror for others to behold.
name: Malformed

biography_description: Their bodies regenerate fast which sometimes allows them to regrow entire limbs.
name: Regenerating

biography_description: They share a strong bond with spiders, although no-one really knows how or why.
name: Spider Worshippers
screen_description:
- Unlocks the Spider mount

- Unlocks the Spider Riders unit

biography_description: Their bards only sing gloomy songs and even their parties are depressing, for they believe an inevitable doom awaits them.
name: Doomed
screen_description:
- No happiness events in cities.Non-Functional

- Other races have -100 Relation with Doomed races.

- +1 Chaos.

biography_description: They are blessed by unnatural luck and love to play games of chance.
name: Lucky Ones
screen_description:
- +5% Crit chance

+5% rewards from clearing Exploration Sites and pick-ups

- Cities have an increased chance of Happiness events

- +1 Chaos

biography_description: They reproduce fast and are despised by other races for the blight and disease they spread.
name: Verminous
screen_description:
- +20% Food income

- Cities have an increased chance of Unhappiness events

- -1 Courage

- -1 Charisma

biography_description: They believe themselves to be Chosen, wanting to show others the the way to their true greatness. These others generally disagree.
name: Chosen

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Unicorn mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They share a deep kinship with Unicorns.
name: Unicorn Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Unicorn mount.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Mounted units are more common and gain a Spider mount.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They share a deep kinship with Spiders.
name: Dread Spider Mounts

effect_descriptions.name: Ruler starts with a Spider mount.

biography_description: They have poison glands which they use to ward off attackers.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Melee attackers have a chance of being poisoned.</helpcolor>
name: Poisonous

effect_descriptions.name: Melee attackers have a base 60% chance of becoming Poisoned.

biography_description: Some call them cold-hearted. They prefer the term \"practical\".
lore_description: <helpcolor>Units are less likely to rout.</helpcolor>
name: Cold Blooded

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units grow strong at a faster rate from winning fights.</helpcolor>
biography_description: With their talent to learn new skills, they can adapt to almost any situation.
name: Adaptable

lore_description: <helpcolor>Rewards smart positioning in combat.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They love to sneak around to find weak spots in their enemies' defenses.
name: Sneaky

lore_description: <helpcolor>Useful for approaching enemy ranged units.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They move with uncanny agility, much to the jealousy of other beings.
name: Quick Reflexes

effect_descriptions.name: 25% harder to hit by ranged attacks.

lore_description: <helpcolor>Ranged shots hit more often.</helpcolor>
biography_description: Their keen vision makes for great feats of archery.
name: Keen-Sighted

lore_description: <helpcolor>Units take less damage from melee attacks.</helpcolor>
biography_description: They are tough and used to taking a few hits in battle.
name: Tough

biography_description: Their blood is strong, which allows them to recuperate from wounds faster than others.
lore_description: <helpcolor>Armies can fight longer on the world map.</helpcolor>
name: Fast Recuperation

effect_descriptions.name: Regenerate an additional +10 <hyperlink><hp></hp> Hit Points</hyperlink> per <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink> <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>.

lore_description: Brutalized by constant battles, these people turn any conflict into carnage.
biography_description: Brutalized by constant battles, they turn any conflict into carnage.
name: Mark of the Butcher
screen_description: Brutalized by constant battles, they turn any conflict into carnage.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Units</hyperlink> of this race earn <xpCol>+50%</xpCol> <hyperlink><xp></xp> Experience</hyperlink> in combat.

<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race lose <fireCol>-2</fireCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> for each <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink>.

lore_description: This race has fostered an intimate bond with the native animals of the realm.
biography_description: Their society has fostered an intimate bond with the native animals of the realm.
name: Mark of the Otter
screen_description: Their society has fostered an intimate bond with the native animals of the realm.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race gain <xpCol>+5 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink></xpCol> for each friendly Animal unit within their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink> up to a maximum of <xpCol>+30 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink></xpCol>.

<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race have <fireCol>-20</fireCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> when there is no friendly Animal unit within their <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink>.

lore_description: This race thrives during times of war and sees in foreign empires only opportunities of conquest.
biography_description: Their society thrives during times of war, and see in foreign empires only opportunities of conquest.
name: Mark of the Sword
screen_description: Their society thrives during times of war, and see in foreign empires only opportunities of conquest.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race generate <xpCol>+10% <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink></xpCol> for each <rs_war></rs_war> <hyperlink>War</hyperlink> their <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> is engaged in.

<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race lose <fireCol>-10 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink></fireCol> for each <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> or <hyperlink>Free City Lord</hyperlink> that has a diplomatic state better than neutral with their <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> (<hyperlink>vassalage</hyperlink> excluded).

lore_description: Residing in their high halls the members of this race look down on all less developed dwellings.
biography_description: Residing in their high halls, they look down on all less developed dwellings.
name: Mark of the Tower
screen_description: Residing in their high halls, they look down on all less developed dwellings.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race with <hyperlink>City Tier</hyperlink> 3 or higher generate <xpCol>+5 <influence></influence> <hyperlink>Imperium</hyperlink></xpCol>.
<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race with <hyperlink>City Tier</hyperlink> 2 or lower generate <fireCol>-10 <influence></influence> <hyperlink>Imperium</hyperlink></fireCol>.

lore_description: With daily life spellcraft, these people have integrated the application of mana deep into their society.
biography_description: With spellcraft as a part of their daily lives, these people have integrated the application of mana deep into their society.
name: Mark of the Conflux
screen_description: With spellcraft as a part of their daily lives, these people have integrated the application of mana deep into their society.

effect_descriptions.name: <hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race gain <xpCol>+1</xpCol> <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink> for each 70 <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> in their controller's global <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> reserve up to a maximum of +30 <happiness></happiness> <hyperlink>City Stability</hyperlink>.
<hyperlink>Cities</hyperlink> of this race generate <fireCol>-1</fireCol> <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> for each <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink> they have.
